intro: Macromeria, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Mexico and the southwestern United States. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. They typically grow in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing their adaptability to arid environments. Macromeria species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens due to their attractive blooms and compact growth habit.
